intro: Ceratocephalus exasperatus, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its deep root system and ability to store water. It produces a capsule fruit that releases seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. Ceratocephalus exasperatus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its ecosystem.
